meanings.definition: relating to or resembling a horse
meanings.sent1: The toy had a horsy design with a mane and tail.
meanings.sent2: She wore a horsy shirt with a picture of a galloping horse.
meanings.sent3: The horsy clock in the living room ticked loudly like hooves.
meanings.sent4: His movements were so smooth, they were almost horsy in nature.
meanings.sent5: The horsy smell of the barn instantly brought back memories of riding.

meanings.definition: having characteristics or qualities associated with horses
meanings.sent1: The strong, muscular man had a horsy build.
meanings.sent2: Her horsy laughter echoed through the stables.
meanings.sent3: The horsy behavior of the children pretending to gallop was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The horsy determination in her eyes showed she wouldn't give up easily.
meanings.sent5: The horsy speed of the car made it feel like a racehorse.

meanings.definition: fond of or interested in horses
meanings.sent1: She had a horsy smile whenever she talked about her favorite horse.
meanings.sent2: The horsy girl spent all her free time at the riding school.
meanings.sent3: His horsy enthusiasm for the rodeo was infectious.
meanings.sent4: The horsy joy in her eyes was evident as she watched the horse show.
meanings.sent5: The horsy passion in his voice made everyone want to join the equestrian club.
